place_name: Radhanagar Beach, Havelock Island (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
best_time: November to May (pleasant weather and clear sea)
nearest_bus: No bus stand available on Havelock Island
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 55 km by sea and road)
accessibility: Accessible by ferry from Port Blair; road transport on the island available; wheelchair-friendly beach access limited due to natural terrain
guided_tours: Available through local operators, mainly in English and Hindi
parking: Available at ferry points on Havelock Island; charges vary (₹20-₹50)
nearby_amenities: Resorts, cafes, small eateries, shops, restrooms
special_notes: Famous for spectacular sunsets; awarded Asia’s Best Beach in 2004 by Time Magazine; pristine coral reefs ideal for snorkeling and diving.

place_name: Cellular Jail, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
best_time: October to May (pleasant weather for sightseeing)
nearest_bus: Phoenix Bay Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 3 km)
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 5 km)
accessibility: Easily accessible by road; mostly wheelchair-friendly with ramps and paved paths
guided_tours: Available in multiple languages including English and Hindi; audio guides offered
parking: Available near the site; free or nominal charges
nearby_amenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms, small parks
special_notes: Known as Kala Pani, a colonial prison used by British to imprison freedom fighters; Light and Sound Show available in evenings depicting historical narratives.

place_name: Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park, Wandoor (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
timings: 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM (seasonal closures may apply)
entry_fee: ₹100 per person (additional fees for snorkeling and boat rides)
best_time: November to May (clear weather ideal for marine activities)
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 30 km)
accessibility: Accessible by road; moderate trekking involved for some islands; not fully wheelchair-friendly
guided_tours: Available, including snorkeling and glass-bottom boat tours with multilingual guides
parking: Available at Wandoor jetty; nominal charges
nearby_amenities: Basic restaurants, restrooms, souvenir shops near entrance
special_notes: Includes several islands with coral reefs and diverse marine life; snorkeling and scuba diving popular; eco-conservation efforts ongoing.

place_name: Chidiya Tapu, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
best_time: November to February (migratory birds and pleasant weather)
nearest_bus: Aberdeen Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 15 km)
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 15 km)
accessibility: Accessible by road; wheelchair-friendly pathways limited
special_notes: Known as the Sunset Point; famous for birdwatching with species like sea eagles and kingfishers; also called the Bird Island.

place_name: Ross Island, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
nearest_bus: Aberdeen Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 3 km to jetty)
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 5 km)
accessibility: Accessible by boat; walking required on uneven terrain; limited wheelchair access
guided_tours: Available with English and Hindi-speaking guides
nearby_amenities: Cafes and shops near jetty area
special_notes: Former British administrative headquarters with ruins; known for deer sightings and historical buildings; underwater coral reefs nearby.

place_name: Neil Island (Shaheed Dweep), Andaman District (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
nearest_bus: No bus stand available on Neil Island
nearest_airport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 40 km by sea and road)
accessibility: Accessible by ferry; road transport on island available; relatively easy terrain; limited wheelchair access
guided_tours: Local guides available; mostly in English and Hindi
parking: Available at ferry points; nominal charges
special_notes: Known for its coral reefs, natural rock formations, and tranquil beaches; less crowded than Havelock.
